channel.title: Raleigh Real Estate Video Blog with rare Properties
channel.description: If you are looking to buy or sell a home, get all the information and the latest updates, tips, and tricks from rare Properties your professional Real Estate Agents.

item.title: Is It Better to Use a Local Mortgage Lender or an Online Provider?
item.description: Getting a mortgage is not as simple as clicking a button, which is why you should opt for a local mortgage lender instead of an online provider.

item.title: How the Mortgage Approval Process Works
item.description: Dan Woodard with Corporate Investors Mortgage Group is here to talk about the mortgage approval process.

item.title: How to Prepare for Inspections as a Buyer or Seller
item.description: When you're selling a home, you can help yourself out a lot by taking care of these items before a home inspection.

item.title: How Does Your Credit Score Impact Buying a Home?
item.description: Brandon Harris from Perennial Mortgage Group joins us today to answer seven common questions about credit scores and mortgages.

item.title: Happy Holidays from rare Properties
item.description: We hope you enjoy this holiday season and make some wonderful memories with friends and family. It truly is the most wonderful time of the year.

item.title: Three Ways to Prepare Your Home for the Market
item.description: Even if you don’t plan on selling until next year, it’s always good to be prepared. Here are three ways to get your home ready now before you list.

item.title: Tips for Rebuilding After Hurricane Matthew
item.description: Hurricane Matthew left a lot of devastation in its wake. Here’s some tips for those of you trying to rebuild after the storm.

item.title: 5 Common Mistakes Home Buyers Make
item.description: The home buying process can be complicated, especially when unexpected issues arise. There are five common mistakes that many home buyers make that can be detrimental to their purchase in the end

item.title: We’re Having a Clothing Drive for Note in the Pocket
item.description: Our guest Shelly works with Note in the Pocket, a small, local organization that provides two weeks of school clothes to children in our county who are living below the poverty line.
